subject: Web3
title: KYC: Know Your Customer
description: A micro-lesson that makes KYC: Know Your Customer usable.

hook.text: KYC requires crypto exchanges to verify your identity before you can trade. It's the price of using regulated platforms.

buildup.text: Exchanges collect passports, selfies, and proof of address. This helps prevent fraud, terrorism financing, and laundering.

discovery.text: KYC made crypto exchanges as regulated as banks in most jurisdictions. Anonymity on centralized platforms is largely gone.

twist.text: KYC data is a honeypot for hackers. Exchange breaches have leaked millions of users' personal documents.

climax.text: KYC creates a tension: it reduces crime but concentrates sensitive data. Better identity solutions are desperately needed.

punchline.text: Exchanges know everything about you. The hackers who breach them do too.

quiz.question: What is a significant risk of KYC data collection?
options: Exchange breaches can expose millions of users' personal identity documents
